intro: Chaetogastra gracilis var. chamissoana, commonly known as the slender chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, temperate environments and is often found in shaded forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitat.
